intro: Acinodendron maximowiczianum, commonly known as the white-flowered acinodendron, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically reddish when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
